TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ResultPropertyValueCollection extends System.Collections.ReadOnlyCollectionBase

Docs.summary: Contains the values of a property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.DirectoryServices.SearchResult> instances are similar to <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry> instances. The notable difference is that the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry> retrieves its information from the Active Directory Domain Services hierarchy each time a new object is accessed, whereas the data for the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.SearchResult> is already available in the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.SearchResultCollection> that a <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher> query returns. If you try to get a <xref:System.DirectoryServices.SearchResult> property that your query did not specify for retrieval, the property will not be available.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Contains(object value) cil managed

Docs.summary: The method determines whether a specified property value is in this collection.
Docs.returns: The return value is if the specified property belongs to this collection; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (object[] values, int index);
.method public hidebysig instance void CopyTo(object[] values, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of type that receives this collection's property values.
The zero-based array index at which to begin copying the property values.
Docs.summary: The method copies the property values from this collection to an array, starting at a particular index of the array.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 IndexOf(object value) cil managed

Docs.summary: The method retrieves the index of a specified property value in this collection.
Docs.returns: The zero-based index of the specified property value. If the object is not found, the return value is -1.

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the property value to retrieve.
Docs.summary: The property gets the property value that is located at a specified index.
Docs.value: The property value that is located at the specified index.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In C#, this property is the indexer for the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ResultPropertyValueCollection> class.
In JScript, you can use the default indexed properties defined by a type, but you cannot explicitly define your own. However, specifying the expando attribute on a class automatically provides a default indexed property with a type of Object and an index type of <xref:System.String>.
